baseline_groups.claim_summary: Effect of 1927 Mississippi flood intensity on log fraction Black population in Southern US counties (continuous-treatment DiD with county + state-by-year FE). Negative expected sign: flood caused Black out-migration.
baseline_groups.outcome_concept: Log fraction Black population in county
baseline_groups.treatment_concept: Flood intensity (share of county flooded) interacted with post-flood year dummies
baseline_groups.estimand_concept: Dynamic ATT path at each post-flood decade (focal: f_int_1950)
baseline_groups.target_population: Southern US counties bordering Mississippi flood zone (>=10% Black, >=15% cotton in 1920), balanced panel
baseline_groups.notes: Two baselines correspond to Table 2 columns 1 and 2. Both succeed. Focal parameter is f_int_1950 (peak effect period). The runner correctly ran many RC variations with both control sets (geo+lags and geo+lags+ND), yielding pairs of specs. LOO blocks are run relative to baseline 2 (geo+lags+ND) only.

baseline_groups.claim_summary: Effect of 1927 Mississippi flood intensity on log value of farm equipment per county (continuous-treatment DiD with county + state-by-year FE). Positive expected sign: labor outflow induced capital substitution toward mechanization.
baseline_groups.outcome_concept: Log value of farm equipment per county (mechanization/capital intensity)
baseline_groups.treatment_concept: Flood intensity (share of county flooded) interacted with post-flood year dummies
baseline_groups.estimand_concept: Dynamic ATT path at each post-flood census year (focal: f_int_1940, adjusted from surface plan f_int_1950)
baseline_groups.target_population: Same as G1 (Southern US counties bordering Mississippi flood zone)
baseline_groups.notes: Baseline 2 (geo+lags+ND) failed due to collinearity: equipment data available for only 5 of 13 panel years (1920, 1925, 1930, 1940, 1970), severely limiting degrees of freedom when adding year-interacted New Deal controls. This is a legitimate collinearity issue. Focal parameter changed from f_int_1950 (surface plan) to f_int_1940 because equipment data unavailable at 1950. 12 of 37 G2 specs failed for similar collinearity reasons. Runner documented this clearly in SPECIFICATION_SEARCH.md deviation notes.

global_notes: Baseline group assignments from SPECIFICATION_SURFACE.json match exactly what appears in specification_results.csv. No adjustments needed.

Two baseline groups (G1, G2) are coherent: G1 tests the labor/migration channel, G2 tests the capital/mechanization channel. Both share the same treatment, design, and population but differ in outcome.

The runner ran most RC variations in pairs (one with geo+lags controls, one with geo+lags+ND controls), which creates duplicate spec_ids within groups. These are distinct specifications with different control sets, not true duplicates.
G2 focal parameter was changed from f_int_1950 to f_int_1940 due to data availability constraints. This is a reasonable deviation documented in SPECIFICATION_SEARCH.md.
Conley spatial SEs (6 rows) report point estimates but no standard errors due to pyfixest limitations. These are partial results.

LOO spec 'drop_tenancy_mfg' in G1 is redundant: baseline 2 (geo+lags+ND) does not include tenancy/mfg controls, so dropping them changes nothing. The result is identical to baseline 2. Similarly, LOO 'drop_new_deal' in G1 is identical to baseline 1.
